main event: A bright silver oval-shaped object was observed hovering in the sky in Brooklyn, New York, during January 1950.
interesting points: The object was the size of a dime and viewed twice before disappearing on the third observation., The object appeared stationary and was described as having no visible reflections., The witness estimated the object to be about 40 to 50 feet in diameter and 15 to 20 feet in height., The sighting lasted approximately 1.25 minutes., The observer was a male traffic patrolman who reported the sighting after watching television.
witness description: A male traffic patrolman, along with a friend who also observed the object.
